intro: Valerianella kotschyi, commonly known as Kotschyi's valerian, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. The plant typically grows as a low-growing herb with finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Valerianella kotschyi is adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its succulent stems and leaves.
